result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy E Lehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with C. McDonald directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant to comply with any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy E Lehman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation - Effective 3/1/2017
Petition for Early Discharge from Probation

Case called @ 2:50 p.m. Defendant Troy E Lehman in court with attorney Joan Ann Olson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 16FO1 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Olson. Statement by DE. Court orders: 60 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ C. McDonald, any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Joan Ann Olson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Olson - in agreement with offer extended and will just reserve argument at the time of sentencing.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on March 16, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Joan Ann Olson in court, appearing via telephone.   Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Olson - believes matter is resolve though awaiting confirmation from her client.  STC Scheduled  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Notice of Retainer, Plea and Request for Jury Trial (Jury Fee Not Paid as to 16FO-1)
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms during the pendency of this matter.

15CM-488 and 16FO-1 - Both Cases Called @ 1:51 PM: Defendant Troy E Lehman in court with attorney Joan Ann Olson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated and Citatin Staed - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP received and entered as to both matters.  ADA argues as to $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by Atty Olson to bond request.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Jury right preserved - although Jury Demand and fee payable within 10 days of today's date as to 16FO-1.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:05 am.
